page.title: 01Landscape - Denny - Dunipace
page.content: The Burgh of Denny and Dunipace is part of Falkirk District in the {Central Region}of Scotland. The historic town of{Stirling}and the Ochil Hills lie about 7 miles to the north. Glasgow is 19 miles south/west. To the east is the busy town of {Falkirk}and the port of Grangemouth on the{Forth.}The beautiful Fintry Hills and Campsie Fells are situated to the west. The Burgh is made up of the small town of Denny and the village of Dunipace and stands on the River Carron. The burgh is built on gentle slopes and the area around is agricultural and very pretty. While local shops can supply most of the needs of the community, large numbers of people shop in Falkirk and Stirling. There are many estates of council houses but more private houses are being built.
